description: in- +‎ secure, or from Medieval Latin insēcūrus, itself from in- (“in-, un-, non-”) + sēcūrus (“safe, certain”)

adjectives.description: insecure (comparative more insecure, superlative most insecure)

entries.meaning: Not comfortable or confident in oneself or in certain situations.
examples: He's a nice guy and all, but seems to be rather insecure around other people.
Imagine being so insecure that you make it against the law for folks to dislike you.
